title: Perranporth Railway Walk Route

nearby.description: Perranporth to Holywell Bay Coastal Walk

images.title: Old railway bridge at Bolingey by Rod Allday, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old railway bridge at Bolingey

images.title: Tony Atkin / Houses at Cocks
images.caption: Houses at Cocks. This small hamlet lies on a minor road called Cocks Hill which runs up a steep coombe off the main valley. This photograph was taken looking northeast down the coombe with the steeply wooded side of the main valley in the distance.

images.title: Malcolm Kewn, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Cocks Viaduct. Central arch of the viaduct constructed in 1903 to carry the Chacewater - Newquay line, now long closed.

images.title: Rod Allday / Old railway bridge abutment
images.caption: Old railway bridge abutment. The bridge went long ago but the stone abutments still remain as a relic of the Newquay-Perranporth line.

description: This walk from Perranporth takes you to Goonhavern along the old Truro and Newquay railway line. The route runs for about 3 miles following the Saints Trail east along the dismantled track. On the way you will pass Bolingey, Cocks Viaduct and the old railway bridges. There's some nice views over the Cornish countryside to enjoy too. To extend your walking in the area you could pick up the Perranporth to St Agnes Walk .
